meanings.definition: The state or quality of being boring.
meanings.sent1: The boringnesses of the lecture made everyone fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: Her story was full of boringnesses that made me yawn.
meanings.sent3: The movie's boringnesses were so intense that even the popcorn fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The boringnesses in the room hung heavy like a thick fog.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's boringnesses were like a lullaby, putting the class into a deep slumber.

meanings.sent1: His constant talking about himself was a major source of boringnesses.
meanings.sent2: The boringnesses of the meeting made everyone check their phones.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt at comedy only added to the boringnesses of the show.
meanings.sent4: The boringnesses of the rainy day seeped into every corner of the house.
meanings.sent5: The boringnesses of the long car ride felt like an eternity.
